page.title: 10A FIRE AT HOME
page.content: I lived on the ground floor. My wee nephew Henry set the living room on fire at half past ten one morning. He {lit paper and stuck it down the chair. There were 4 people in the house at the time. During the fire Dad ran up the hall to see if Henry was there and the flames singed his hair and eyebrows. Someone kicked the door in and told him Henry was outside so he shut all the doors to stop the flames spreading and he jumped out of the back window. Someone grabbed a ladder and helped the people above onto their verandas. They climbed down the verandas with their children. The fire brigade came in 5 minutes. The living room was right through to the brick, the hall had hardly any ceiling and the rooms were all smoke damaged.{We {were not insured for fire}so it's going to cost a lot of money.
